intro: Phaeomeria novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea phaeomeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense, colorful heads. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant display.
